metadata.Title: CVE-2018-13303 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
In FFmpeg 4.0.1, a missing check for failure of a call to init_get_bits8() in the avpriv_ac3_parse_header function in libavcodec/ac3_parser.c may trigger a NULL pointer dereference while converting a crafted AVI file to MPEG4, leading to a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13303` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.0.2-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.0.2-1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.0.2-1
libavcodec58 - 7:4.0.2-1
libavdevice58 - 7:4.0.2-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.0.2-1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.0.2-1
libavfilter7 - 7:4.0.2-1
libavformat58 - 7:4.0.2-1
libavresample4 - 7:4.0.2-1
libavutil56 - 7:4.0.2-1
libpostproc55 - 7:4.0.2-1
libswresample3 - 7:4.0.2-1
libswscale5 - 7:4.0.2-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> marking chromium-browser as ignored, since we do full-version updates, and rely on upstream's bundled ffmpeg version

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
ffmpeg package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.0.2-1').
gst-libav1.0 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
kino package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mythtv package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
vice package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
